docs.snippet: The United States has softened its stance on Syria including the future of President Bashar al-Assad to accommodate Russia, opposition coordinator Riad Hijab said, warning the opposition would face a hard choice on whether to attend peace talks th...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States has softened its stance on Syria including the future of President Bashar al-Assad to accommodate Russia, opposition coordinator Riad Hijab said, warning the opposition would face a hard choice on whether to attend peace talks this month.

headline.main: Syrian Opposition Coordinator Says U.S. Clearly Backtracked Over Syria
headline.print_headline: Syrian Opposition Coordinator Says U.S. Clearly Backtracked Over Syria

docs.snippet: Jaroslaw Kaczynski holds no elective office, but as leader of the governing Law and Justice Party he is the primary force in a rightist consolidation of authority....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jaroslaw Kaczynski holds no elective office, but as leader of the governing Law and Justice Party he is the primary force in a rightist consolidation of authority.
docs.abstract: Abrupt shift of Poland's newly-elected conservative government into nationalistic and authoritarian direction is attributed to Law and Justice party leader Jaroslaw Kaczynski; unelected former Solidarity member lost twin brother, former Pres Lech Kaczynski in 2010 plane crash; criticism from European leaders, Western media and domestic political opposition is met with defiance.

headline.main: Head of Poland’s Governing Party Leads a Shift Rightward
headline.print_headline: Head of Poland’s Governing Party Leads a Political Shift Rightward

docs.snippet: The Energy Department and the Pentagon have been readying a weapon with a build-it-smaller approach, setting off a philosophical clash in the world of nuclear arms....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Energy Department and the Pentagon have been readying a weapon with a build-it-smaller approach, setting off a philosophical clash in the world of nuclear arms.
docs.abstract: United States military is making smaller nuclear bomb, adapted from older weapon, that is designed to more precisely attack targets; build-it-smaller plan sparks philosophical conflict among officials, some of whom say that smaller and more reliable arsenal will be improvement, while others worry advanced weapons will tempt military to use, and even use first, rather than in retaliation.

headline.main: As U.S. Modernizes Nuclear Weapons, ‘Smaller’ Leaves Some Uneasy
headline.print_headline: Smaller Bombs Are Adding Fuel to Nuclear Fear

docs.snippet: Descendants of the settlers, who embarked in 1764 on a trek that took them from the northeast to the west, struggle to keep a nearly vanished tongue alive....
docs.lead_paragraph: Descendants of the settlers, who embarked in 1764 on a trek that took them from the northeast to the west, struggle to keep a nearly vanished tongue alive.
docs.abstract: Qapqal County Journal; Xibe branch of Manchu tribe represents final remaining link to culture of Qing dynasty-era China; 18th century migration of Manchu settlers into isolated Central Asia preserved their language against continuing encroachment of Mandarin, enabling scholars to translate key historical documents.

headline.main: Manchu, Former Empire’s Language, Hangs On at China’s Edge
headline.print_headline: Manchu, Once a Language of Empire, Nears Extinction

byline.contributor: Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.
